Line 264: Line 264:
Similarly, some analysts maintain that whatever the source of modern Jihadi terrorism and the actions and words of some rogue members, the Brotherhood now has little in common with radical Islamists and modern jihadists who often condemn the Brotherhood as too moderate. They also deny the existence of any centralized and secretive global MB leadership.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.foreignaffairs.org/20070301faessay86208/robert-s-leiken-steven-brooke/the-moderate-muslim-brotherhood.html|title=The Moderate Muslim Brotherhood}}</ref> Some claim that the origins of modern Muslim terrorism are found in [[Wahhabi]] ideology, not that of the Muslim Brotherhood.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.buzzle.com/editorials/4-10-2006-93214.asp|title=The root of terrorism is Wahabism}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ataturksociety.org/letters/tarhan.html|title=The root of terrorism}}</ref>
Similarly, some analysts maintain that whatever the source of modern Jihadi terrorism and the actions and words of some rogue members, the Brotherhood now has little in common with radical Islamists and modern jihadists who often condemn the Brotherhood as too moderate. They also deny the existence of any centralized and secretive global MB leadership.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.foreignaffairs.org/20070301faessay86208/robert-s-leiken-steven-brooke/the-moderate-muslim-brotherhood.html|title=The Moderate Muslim Brotherhood}}</ref> Some claim that the origins of modern Muslim terrorism are found in [[Wahhabi]] ideology, not that of the Muslim Brotherhood.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.buzzle.com/editorials/4-10-2006-93214.asp|title=The root of terrorism is Wahabism}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ataturksociety.org/letters/tarhan.html|title=The root of terrorism}}</ref>
